intro: Leucanthemum vulgare subsp. discoideum, commonly known as the common white marguerite, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It features daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center, blooming from late spring to early autumn. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and has basal leaves that are spoon-shaped and hairy. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in meadows and along roadsides. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscaping.
